website_summaries.verdict: If you only have $100 to spend on a multifunction inkjet printer for the office, you'll have a hard time finding a faster performer with ink refills as cheap as the Brother MFC-J470DW.
pros: The Brother MFC-J470DW boasts fast print speeds, cloud connectivity, Apple AirPrint and Google Chrome Print compatibility, four separate ink tanks, and a supremely low cost of consumables
cons: The cheap rubber buttons and an overall plastic feel of the unit don't transcend its bargain price tag

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Judging by the number of 5 star reviews, I had high hopes for this printer. After using it for several months, I'm not super impressed with it. It is a very cheaply made printer. The top folder cover for scanning feels like it's going to break off every time I open it to scan something. I'm also not a fan of the scanning options. You can't easily save the file local to your computer. I have to save it to my OneDrive account, then download it to my computer. The scanning quality isn't great, either. If I had to buy a printer again, I would probably go with something else.
customer_reviews.author: lnferno

customer_reviews.title: Cuss word generator
customer_reviews.text: This was rated 4.5 when I purchased it. Can't believe/trust who is doing the reviews anymore. First: the scan & print software are 2 different programs (mac). Finding the print setup software is another challenge to find. This is the most convoluted software ever. Second: this printer is seldom found by my Mac. Sometimes i can get it to scan or print but never both after turning my internet off/on as well as the pc and printer. Printing or scanning a single page is at least a half hour project. If you're looking for a cuss word generator this is it....if you want a reliable printer shop another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Shenanigans

customer_reviews.title: it is easy to change printer ink
customer_reviews.text: Chronic paper jams, especially with non-standard (photo, matte, poster) paper. Loads multiple sheets often. Difficult to re-set after a jam. Requires many steps and button presses. Difficult to load paper, tray must be completely removed. One plus, it is easy to change printer ink.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burton

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: For a printer it's great! only time will tell how long it lasts but so far I absolutely love it and I tend to detest cheap crappy printers with a passion. Love that it goes into sleep mode, is energy efficient, easy to install and use, and very user friendly. I did not like how it would pause printing to receive the next print order, really slowing the process down when sending several print orders to the queue simultaneously. Besides that, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: CathleenC.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 10 months, only.
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked as expected for 10 months. We printed, scanned, faxed without any problems. The cheaper non- Bother printer ink worked most of the time. Just recently we started getting paper jams and then it would say it was jammed even when it wasn't. I called Brother and we tried a few things to fix it, but to no avail. He said I would have to take it to a repair shop. According to the serial number it was past the 1 year warranty. Thank goodness Amazon keeps records online because I had no receipt. Brother agreed to send a new one, which should arrive soon.
customer_reviews.author: V. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: sucks; wifi connection did not work well
customer_reviews.text: sucks; wifi connection did not work well; it worked ( so i know i installed it right)- then it wouldn't. printing was mediocre; i wanted to try a different brand but back to hp i went. so much better- no matter the model
customer_reviews.author: jose reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: Received the printer yesterday. In less than 30 min, had it up and running on my WiFi network (really slick install wizard!) and drivers installed on 2 MacBookAirs, an iMAC and a Windows10 PC. Everything worked flawlessly. Love the compact footprint. Printouts seem SLIGHTLY lower quality than the HP that this printer replaced, but still look great. One of the selling points for me for this printer was the low-cost ink/low cost per page. It will take a month or so to see if this turns out to be true; if not, I'll post another review. All in all, I'm VERY pleased.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rasor

customer_reviews.title: ... IS EXACTLY AS STATED AND I HAVE BEEN VERY SATISFIED WITH IT
customer_reviews.text: PRINTER IS EXACTLY AS STATED AND I HAVE BEEN VERY SATISFIED WITH IT. UNFORTUNATELY I BOUGHT A 10 PAK OF REPLACEMENT INK CARTRIDGES FOR IT BUT THE VENDOR, T-SURPLUS, SOLD ME COUNTERFIT CARTRIDGES AND THEY LEAKED ALL OVER MY HANDS AND INSIDE OF MY NEW PRINTER. HE IS DAMAGING YOUR REPUTATION AND YOU SHOULD REMOVE HIM FROM YOUR RELIABLE VENDOR LIST.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Bought this and it has been plagued with problems from ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and it has been plagued with problems from day 1. Right from the start wouldn't print. After long back and forth with the company doing diagnostics and trying lots of things it finally did work for a little while, now doesn't again. Different problem from the first time, but the problems all are related to ink cartridges not loading properly, even though I'm using brand new cartridges of the right type purchased directly from Brother. In other words, this machine had a properly functioning lifetime of zero. It's cheap, but don't buy it - definitely not worth the hassle. Spend a little more and get a printer that actually prints.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Very good addition to our little office
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues with my provider, but printer itself is doing fine! Easy to start up, just install software and go. I am technologically impaired and even I could do it. It has worked well for 3 months now. It updates in the middle of the night occasionally, which always interests the dogs. You have to be sure that your provider is sending you a good enough signal before you start trying to blame the printer. Our area does not always have great service, and the printer can't function without a full connection. I say this because I didn't know that this was occurring until I bought a printer. No problems with printer itself.
customer_reviews.author: pip

customer_reviews.title: easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up--HOWEVER it was missing a cable. Fortunately I had one from my recently deceased Lexmark printer that fit. This brother has functions that I want. Reviews about noise & printing speed are accurate. Arrived promptly. I think the individual cartridges for each color & B&W are a good idea so I can replace what's needed. Color printing to plain paper--to go in my snail mail letters is not the best but perhaps I have not adequately played with the settings. I suspect it will do better on photo paper--but IMHO if you want good prints use a photo print shop. I think probably good for recommended purpose of moderate home office use.
customer_reviews.author: tck

customer_reviews.title: Basically an OK multi-function unit.
customer_reviews.text: Started out OK. We chose this printer because we could refill the cartridges. The starter cartridges printed WAAAY more than we expected - bonus. It installed itself fairly well, however we had to do it a couple of times to get the wireless working. Print speed is quick. Scanning is efficient and easy. After 6 months, we are not quite as happy: it is now printing each page several times and going through gobs of paper while it sends the computer a message saying it can't print it at all. This is happening even if we use the wired connection. ??
customer_reviews.author: F. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Brother MFC-J470DW
customer_reviews.text: update I asked for a refund and Special Gift Box refused. Don't buy from this company! , The other printer I bought was from Special Gift Box. No problems. I thought this was a nice printer for the price but, I've had to call Brother twice to have drivers reinstalled. When I try to print I have to go from my living room to my office to start the printing. Now, It says it can't find the printer although it found it yesterday. I wouldn't waste my money on this piece of junk and would advise anyone thinking about buying this printer, you get what you pay for. I hope it's not too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: m speir

customer_reviews.title: Great potential, it would be better if I could ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a printer for wireless printing from my phone, worked when I first set it up, but fails to stay connected to router, plus it wouldn't connect with the Comcast modem/wireless router, I had to use my old Linksys router. I give it 3 stars because it worked once, so I know it's capitable, and printer manufactures are very slow to develop user friendly plug and play software, so I just have to go get a degree in printer software/hardware engineering to get it to work again. Great potential, it would be better if I could hardwire it, but there are no ports to hardwire it to the router.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer ever
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been non-stop problems. Would not connect wireless with my Mac unless I turned it on and off and on again before printing despite spending hours on the help line trying to resolve. Jams often. Now at 6 months old it will not print. I have always had Brother printers before but am switching to an HP
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Parks

customer_reviews.title: Very hard of hearing
customer_reviews.text: This printer's print quality is generally good. It scans documents and copies them well. However, it is very hard of hearing when it comes to WIFI reception. You must have a big, blasting WIFI signal in order for the printer to work as it should. This accounts for my fairly low rating. Move on to some other option.
customer_reviews.author: N. Crapster

customer_reviews.title: Way too many problems with this unit
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had not purchased this printer. My old Epson, which cost less was far superior in every way. This prints poorly, can't figure out the scanning and worst of all, as I use it in my bedroom office, I have to unplug it every night as it wakes up at about 2:30 a.m. to perform some maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: RH SF

customer_reviews.title: This printer prints things
customer_reviews.text: works well with iphone, ipad, imac, and PC -- i have no need to test the fax feature but the duplexer saves paper, the ink is reasonably cheap, the print quality is good for what my family uses it for (homework, shipping labels, etc) and the scan function works -- cant really ask for a lot more in a home printer
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE POS!!!
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTE POS!!! My wife and I just spent 4 hours on a Sunday trying to set up this printer in our new home, with no success. Not sure why it refuses to recognize our new WiFi system, but for some reason it does, so this printer is WORTHLESS to us! Tomorrow I will be sending this unit to the landfill, where it belongs! DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: TurboDog

customer_reviews.title: it's a nice purchase. It was easy for me to set ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's a nice purchase. It was easy for me to set up and I'm not tech savvy. I was able to put the ink cartridges in, set up the app so that I can print from my iPhone and iPad, and set up to print from my Mac computer. Brother should make more colors. I would have liked a silver or even a nightly colored pink or green but that's cosmetic. This is a really good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Christine D

customer_reviews.title: Brother machines, always reliable. This? No exception.  Clayton
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine because its predecessor, which served me faithfully "died." Recommend Brother printers anytime. Clayton
customer_reviews.author: clayton Carter

customer_reviews.title: Better than the competition
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer, better than HP or Epson by a long shot. Easy to set up and use, intuitive. Easy on ink, too, which is a plus. I had no reason to talk to customer service but I hope they keep my good opinion going, should I need to. My experiences with HP and Epson's customer service were horrendous as neither printer lasted long. This has already been in use longer and is going strong. I like its design..easier to replace ink and paper.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Find something better for your money.
customer_reviews.text: I work professionally in commercial printing. I am flabbergasted that a machine, even a small one like this, that prints true CMYK has such TERRIBLE color quality. The ink cartridges don't last long. This printer's only saving grace is that it has very good wireless functionality.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Seitler

customer_reviews.title: Brother MFC-J470DW breakdown after 13 days of use
customer_reviews.text: Printer worked fine for 13 days then paper would not feed. I followed each step in the troubleshooting guide (six times) and no fix. Called HELP --- repeated troubleshooting steps and NO fix. Offered a "refurbished" replacement which I was told just indicated that the printer had be returned unused. Did received a warranty extension. Now waiting for "new" printer.
customer_reviews.author: David S Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Problem with the paper feeder after only 2 years of light home use. Had to replace it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in May 2016, and did not have a chance to set it up for a while. We have mostly used it for home jobs, so it had relatively little use. The pages started jamming more frequently a few months ago, and this week it started jamming every time it pulled from the paper-tray. I did all the troubleshooting and worked with the Brother chat line last night. They said that it needed to be serviced. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: Great printer... tricky set up
customer_reviews.text: Still one of those devices where you say, "how could a layperson be expected to set this thing up", but works flawlessly once done. The wireless setup requires the printer to be put in the mode where it's looking for a computer that has already had the software installed, and this whole process works well, believe it or not.
customer_reviews.author: J. Raposa

customer_reviews.title: Did not work. After countless months and chats and ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. After countless months and chats and phone calls to manufacture it is a defective part. BUT because the trouble shooting process was so long I am not over my 30 day return time. So my only option is to pay to ship it to them for them to check it out. This is a business and this has been a total inconvenience. I have had countless other Brother products and never had this kind of trouble. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy: Doesn't maintain Wifi connection
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a printer that connects to Wifi? LOOK ELSEWHERE. This printer CAN NOT maintain a wifi connection. Each time I need to print something, I have to walk over to the printer and find my wifi and enter the password. This is honestly the worst product I've ever bought from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: but so far so good. Copies are crisp
customer_reviews.text: Installed only recently, but so far so good. Copies are crisp, speed faster than HP it replaced, it's quiet, and no aggravating paper jams yet. Minor minuses: pull out paper tray doesn't feel solid, paper capacity could be greater, somewhat inconvenient to print envelopes. Summary: satisfied in that it does what it's supposed to do

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm liking it. Seems like ink lasts a lot longer than my previous Epson all-in-one, and I like that there are only three color cartridges (vs 6 in my old one). I printed many, many pages after the low/out of ink warning popped up, though. So take your time changing them! I haven't used it for printing photos, so can't comment on picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E Wirth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great printer. It works well and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda S.

customer_reviews.title: The whole printing cartridge industry is criminal and Brother is the worst.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY Their proprietary cartridges register as empty, when they are actually almost full. Get an HP. The whole printing cartridge industry is criminal and Brother is the worst.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Brother printer just average.
customer_reviews.text: The Brother MFC-1470DW did not meet my expectations. When I am sent an E-Mail photograph and print it the quality is not very good. Loses a lot of contrast. The proportion scale does not give me enough control over the size of prints I want to make. Either to small or too large. The ink cartridges seem to last longer then the Epson I got rid of. It is not as good as it is beong advertised. There a lot of less expensive printers I should have chosen, print quality is just average.
customer_reviews.author: PinchTown Prince

customer_reviews.title: The printer's menu interface is HORRIBLE, which makes things hard to troubleshoot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer exclusively for Google Cloud Print. It was working correctly at first, but is EXTREMELY BUGGY. The printer's menu interface is HORRIBLE, which makes things hard to troubleshoot. I don't understand how printer manufacturers haven't figured out how to easily connect printers to home networks, cloud printing services, etc.
customer_reviews.author: WilliamWallace

customer_reviews.title: What a Relief!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new printer because I could not get my other printer to hook up wirelessly to all my electronic devices In my house. This one was easy,, and I did not eve have to use a cable to hook up to my desktop. Everything from laptop,tablets,phones, everything hooked up first time.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki H

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is several years old now and still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this printer to my worst enemy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer on the basis of the 4 star reviews it was getting and it has been nothing but trouble. The black ink constantly will print too light and the indicator light saying I should put a new cartridge. I do and the light keeps coming on. It says when this happens to make sure to press the cartridge all the way in, which I have done at least two dozen times. Cleaning the heads works for a while and then it will fade and it will be " out of (black) ink". The other problem is that it holds very little paper. It must be refilled often. I would not recommend this printer to my worst enemy.
customer_reviews.author: Raphael Klarfeld

customer_reviews.title: Poor Scanner Feature
customer_reviews.text: To preface, I use my printer to scan documents more than anything else. After using this product for just 1 week I started having problems w/ the scanner feature. With pages in the tray it would not communicate w/ my laptop. The solution was to power off the printer before each scan, but then it wouldn't even shut it self down resulting me having to unplug the printer before each scan. Neither efficient nor convenient. I plan to by an HP, but stuck with this in the mean time.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent and Lara Grande

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the ink run dry
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the 295CN brother which had served me well for years. This unit worked well for a few months, then the black ink head clogged either from letting the ink run too low or using generic cartridges. I was able to clean the black ink head with a $20 kit off amazon. DO NOT let the ink run dry, change it out as soon as you get the alert.
customer_reviews.author: jkolo

customer_reviews.title: Brother J470DW
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer: Wireless hooks up with little effort, quality good for the price point, speed is a little slow but for the money I can wait of few seconds more
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellant printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing printer that really puts out quality prints! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Peters

customer_reviews.title: The printer function works fine, but the wireless setup and connection is awful
customer_reviews.text: The printer function works fine, but the wireless setup and connection is awful. I finally got everything set up, and it worked for a little while, but the printer eventually forgot my settings. Since then, nothing I've tried has worked, even though the printer claims it is connected to my network.
customer_reviews.author: RHK

customer_reviews.title: installation nightmare-need Brother Support
customer_reviews.text: I just received the printer and be prepared for a nightmare trying to install it. I have wireless set up and with an installation disc I thought it would be a breeze. No. I read another review and that advice was the best. First install the printer into the network and then use the disc to install the software and drivers. I finally had to use the support # which involves long waits on the phone but the Brother support did get my printer installed.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: A good choice.
customer_reviews.text: Happy so far. I didn't care for the optional Nuance PaperPort and PDF reader that came on the install CD. But they were optional and were also easy to uninstall. I had to power down the printer once before I could connect to the wireless network. Other than that, the set up was easy.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Printer
customer_reviews.text: Good quality printer and scanner for my home office. Quiet and fast. My only issue is I have some difficulty printing my #10 envelopes. As I print more, I may be able to figure out how to load them where they don't jam as often.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good photo quality
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good photo quality, inks far cheaper than Epson. Like the double-sided print feature. The paper tray doesn't hold very much paper and can be finicky if you don't have it exactly placed in the tray for feeding, but that is a minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Hermetia illucens

customer_reviews.title: I love that this inexpensive printer/scanner/fax can scan multiple pages which ...
customer_reviews.text: What a workhorse. I love that this inexpensive printer/scanner/fax can scan multiple pages which you can then send right to an e-mail. I probably wouldn't use it to print high quality photos, but it gets the job done. So glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Mesquite Girl

customer_reviews.title: Mom Proof Printer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom as she was always having problems with her (more expensive) old printer. I have yet to be called over to fix this printer and it's been a couple months, so that's 5 stars in my book!
customer_reviews.author: Siouxperman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and good instructions for a change
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and good instructions for a change. Worked right out of the box. Only problem was if you can't use their CD, you have to go online to find out how to install the software so that you can scan.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Great printer, bit of a pain to use the screen on the printer, been using it for years now, works great.
customer_reviews.author: E. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Crappy quality.
customer_reviews.text: The 3rd time I used the printer, the printer skipped rows, as if it were running out of ink. This was after fighting with the printer to sense that paper was there. Crappy quality. UPDATE: Over the past few months, I have yet to print something with quality. The back falls open and the paper falls out the back; frequent paper jams, and crappy quality of printing.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Prints are nice and clear. Nice printer glad I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Good printer.
customer_reviews.text: Mostly works good. Printing from I-devices is easy. No setup needed. It is a bit slow, and we sometimes have trouble with not all the pages printing, but that may be user error.
customer_reviews.author: D. Michel

customer_reviews.title: Dont believe the hype
customer_reviews.text: This printer is not as fast as they say. Its the slowest printer I've ever owned in fact. It is not user friendly and neither are the apps to use with mobile printing. The only reason I won't return this is because my husband already threw out the box.
customer_reviews.author: DezMa

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been a workhorse for me. I am a teacher and learned about this printer online. I have bought the non-Brother cartridges - in fact cartridges here on Amazon, and they have worked fine. I just opened my big mouth this week and told a friend how great my printer is and all of a sudden I am having problems printing. I will call Brother to see if they can help or if this is the end. Anyways, it has been great, used it everyday and made thousands and thousands of quality color pages for my classes.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Halpern

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely GREAT little printer!!!
customer_reviews.text: We home school, so it gets quite the workout. Quickly prints both B&W and color. Easy to scan, copy, change print cartridges (highly recommend XL cartridges -- we never seem to need to change them except for black), and add paper. The only down-side (and not a biggie for us) is the paper tray doesn't hold a whole lot of paper -- but a very minor issue for our use. And the Brother "help" icon is a total blessing ... well thought out and intuitive to use. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. I have two of them. We got one for home, loved it and then when my office printer broke I ordered another one. It's wireless, brother makes an app to print from your Iphone/Android. You can buy individual color cartridges so you can just replace the one that's empty rather than replace and entire tri-color cartridge. That saves a lot of money over time. I don't use the fax feature, but the copier/scanner work fine and the print quality is great. I haven't tried printing high quality pictures with it (i'm sure you'd want a specialty printer for that), I do print a lot of flyers, postcards, handouts, etc and they all look great.
customer_reviews.author: J. N.

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great printer for the price. Prints quickly & quietly. One concern is that the paper tray doesn't hold very much & it feels flimsy. I'm cautious when loading paper because it's hard to know if the paper is securely in the right place. I'm a bit worried about durability of the parts of the tray over time.
customer_reviews.author: Dell user

customer_reviews.title: GOOD ENTRY LEVEL PRINTER FOR THE HOME
customer_reviews.text: A GREAT VALUE FOR THE PRICE; LIMITED PAPER SUPPLY TRAY BUT WORKS WELL FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.author: Harry M. Merrick IV

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: My husband works from home so we purchased the printer for him. Since then I use it all the time to print from our phones and IPads. Really good quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Barb75022

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer - copies and prints quickly
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer - copies and prints quickly, is very solid. It is head and shoulders above our HP, which was terrible from the get go.

customer_reviews.text: doesn't print bar codes very well. colored scans are always fade. takes a while (around 10 seconds) to output black n white prints. colored prints would take 4 times of that of a black n white print. we returned ours back to seller after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.author: Jas B

customer_reviews.title: Just wireless
customer_reviews.text: Have several Brothers printers and wanted to get one that used the same ink. Didn’t notice that this one could not be hardwired.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome features and very easy to intall and operate. Ink cost is significantly lower than my last printer which was a Canon. I love the ability to print on both sides. Great feature for a home printer in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: SmokinBiz

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The wifi wireless printing was a breeze to hook up which is more than I can say for the Epson WF-3520 (directions are hopeless!)
customer_reviews.author: Brian T.

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but it takes a little money to ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but it takes a little money to use it to do envelopes and 4 x 6pics. Quality is average, not exceptional, but I do feel that it is reliable, so we shall see how long this lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara W. Bromberg

customer_reviews.title: Has excellent wireless range
customer_reviews.text: Had a few issues setting up. Included set up disk was not compatible with mac and had to download from product support. No big deal. Has excellent wireless range.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, good price, high rating, great copies, great two sided copies. Installation on Mac has to be done on the phone with serviceman.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fairly well, sometimes I have to turn it off to make it work again.
customer_reviews.author: Mariilyn M

customer_reviews.title: Best low cost printer
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer. Understand it's a low cost unit, but works great and the software is good also. We have several in our office so I purchased one for the home. Great scanner. Sometimes on sale for $69.00.
customer_reviews.author: Th577

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous printer!!! First time Brother buyer, but will buy from again!!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: 1 month.  Great product!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Had it for a month. Does a great job, connects via wifi easily, and uses low ink.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Mobile friendly
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer that everyone in the family uses to print even from the mobile phone.
